html:
Verb[edit]

iacēbimus

  1. first-person plural future active indicative of iaceō
    1. "we shall lie prostrate, we shall lie down; we shall recline"
    2. "we shall lie ill, we shall be sick"
    3. "we shall linger, we shall tarry"
    4. "we shall be placed or situated, we shall lie"
    5. "we shall be low, flat or level"
    6. "we shall lie still"
    7. "we shall lie dead"
    8. "we shall lie in ruins"
    9. "we shall hang down loose"
    10. (of the face or eyes) "we shall be fixed on the ground, we shall be cast down"
    11. "we shall be indolent, idle or inactive"
    12. "we shall lie dormant or abandoned, we shall be of no avail"
    13. "we shall lie overthrown; we shall be refuted; we shall be despised"
    14. (of speech or language) "we shall be languid, dull or lifeless"
